item.title: Katie add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Imagination has brought mankind through the Dark Ages to its present state of civilization. Imagination led Columbus to discover America. Imagination led Franklin to discover electricity. Imagination has given us the steam engine, the telephone, the talking-machine and the automobile, for these things had to be dreamed of before they became realities. So I believe that dreams - day dreams, you know, with your eyes wide open and your brain-machinery whizzing - are likely to lead to the betterment of the world. The imaginative child will become the imaginative man or woman most apt to create, to invent, and therefore to foster civilization." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Katie add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Katie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description:
"In a utilitarian age, of all other times, it is a matter of grave importance that fairy tales should be respected."
(<i>Frauds on the Fairies</i>, 1853)" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Katie add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Stunt dwarf or destroy the imagination of a child and you have taken away its chances of success in life. Imagination transforms the commonplace into the great and creates the new out of the old." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Katie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katie add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "To please a child is a sweet and lovely thing that warms one's heart and brings its own reward." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Katie add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Never give up. No one knows what's going to happen next." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Katie add a quote by Malinda Lo
item.description: "making a decision isn't about knowing every potential consequence. It's about knowing what you want and chasing a path that takes you in that direction" -- Malinda Lo

item.title: Katie add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Katie add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Katie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Katie add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jane Goodall
item.description: "What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make." -- Jane Goodall

item.title: Katie add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Katie add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Katie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Double, double, toil and trouble; Fire burn, and cauldron bubble!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Katie add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Katie add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Katie add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Katie add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "I not only use all the brains that I have, but all I can borrow." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Katie add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Katie add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Katie add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "To paraphrase several sages: Nobody can think and hit someone at the same time." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dumas Malone
item.description: "The boldness of his mind was sheathed in a scabbard of politeness." -- Dumas Malone

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "Don't loaf and invite inspiration; light out after it with a club." -- Jack London

item.title: Katie add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Katie add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Katie add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Katie add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Katie add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander
